definitions.definition: A piece of burning wood or peat, or a glowing cinder.
definitions.example: To burn something to brands and ashes.

definitions.definition: A mark or scar made by burning with a hot iron, especially to mark cattle or to classify the contents of a cask.
The symbolic identity, represented by a name and/or a logo, which indicates a certain product or service to the public.
A specific product, service, or provider so distinguished.
definitions.example: Some brands of breakfast cereal contain a lot of sugar.

definitions.definition: (by extension) Any specific type or variety of something; a distinct style or manner.
definitions.example: I didn't appreciate his particular brand of flattery.

definitions.definition: The public image or reputation and recognized, typical style of an individual or group.
Any minute fungus producing a burnt appearance in plants.
To burn the flesh with a hot iron, either as a marker (for criminals, slaves etc.) or to cauterise a wound.
definitions.example: When they caught him, he was branded and then locked up.

definitions.definition: To mark (especially cattle) with a brand as proof of ownership.
definitions.example: The ranch hands had to brand every new calf by lunchtime.

definitions.definition: To make an indelible impression on the memory or senses.
definitions.example: Her face is branded upon my memory.
He was branded a fool by everyone that heard his story.

definitions.definition: To associate a product or service with a trademark or other name and related images.
definitions.example: They branded the new detergent "Suds-O", with a nature scene inside a green O on the muted-colored recycled-cardboard box.
